forYou.reason4: You value privacy and full control over your data — no logs, no tracking
forYou.reason5: You need a simple “view once → gone” approach, with no history or repeated access

general.heading: General Questions
general.a1: sdbx is a zero-knowledge file and text sharing service. It lets you securely share files (up to 500MB) and text secrets with end-to-end encryption. By default, content is accessed once and then permanently deleted. Vault and PIN modes also support multi-access sharing — content is automatically deleted when the expiration time (TTL) is reached.
general.q2: Do I need to create an account?
general.a2: No! sdbx requires no registration, no email, and no personal information. Simply upload your file or text, get a secure link, and share it. That's it.
general.a3: Yes, sdbx is completely free to use. There are no premium tiers, no ads, and no hidden costs.
general.q4: What can I share with sdbx?
general.a4html: Two types of content: Files (any file type up to 500MB) and Text secrets (up to 1000 characters for passwords, API keys, notes, etc.).

security.heading: Security & Privacy
security.a1: Zero-knowledge means we cannot access your content, even if we wanted to. Your files are encrypted in your browser before upload, and the encryption key is stored only in the URL fragment (#), which is never sent to our servers.
security.a2: AES-256-GCM with 256-bit keys generated randomly in your browser. Each encryption uses a fresh initialization vector. All communications use TLS 1.2+.
security.q3: Can you see what I upload?
security.a3: No. We cannot see your file contents or text secrets. Everything is encrypted before it leaves your browser. We only see encrypted data, file size, and expiration time. In PIN mode, we also store the filename to deliver it to the recipient, but only temporarily — for a maximum of TTL time (24 hours). All stored data is automatically deleted after the first download or when the expiration time (TTL) is reached.
security.q4: Do you log IP addresses or track users?
security.a4: No tracking whatsoever. We store only a SHA-256 hash of your IP address for abuse prevention — the original IP cannot be recovered from the hash. We don't use cookies, don't run analytics, and don't track users in any way.
security.a5html: Yes! Fully open source and available on GitHub. Security researchers are welcome to audit our code.

howItWorks.heading: How It Works
howItWorks.q1: Why can files only be downloaded once by default?
howItWorks.a1: One-time access is the default security model for URL link sharing. Once the recipient downloads the file, it's permanently deleted from our servers. However, Vault mode and PIN mode offer multi-access sharing — content stays available and is automatically deleted when the expiration time (TTL) is reached.
howItWorks.q2: What happens if my download fails due to network issues?
howItWorks.a2: sdbx uses a two-phase download system: when you click download, the file is reserved for 10 minutes. If your connection drops, you can retry with the same link within that window. After successful download, the file is permanently deleted.
howItWorks.q3: How long do files stay available?
howItWorks.a3: You choose when you upload: 1 hour, 12 hours, or 24 hours. After this time, files are automatically deleted, even if not downloaded.
howItWorks.q4: What's the difference between file sharing and text secrets?
howItWorks.a4: Both are encrypted the same way. Files are for documents/images up to 500MB (downloaded as a file). Text secrets are for passwords/keys up to 1000 characters (displayed directly in browser with copy button).
howItWorks.q5: Where is the encryption key stored?
howItWorks.a5: In the URL fragment (the part after #). URL fragments are never sent to servers by browsers. The key exists only in the shareable link.

limitations.heading: Limitations & Troubleshooting
limitations.a1: 500 MB. For larger files, consider compressing or splitting them.
limitations.a2: All modern browsers: Chrome 37+, Firefox 34+, Safari 11+, Edge 79+. Desktop browsers recommended for large files.
limitations.q3: I lost my link. Can you recover it?
limitations.a3: Unfortunately, no. Since we never see your encryption key, there's no way to recover your link. Always save links before closing the page.
limitations.q4: The link says "already downloaded" but I didn't download anything!
limitations.a4: Possible reasons: someone else with the link downloaded it first, the file expired, or link preview features in messaging apps triggered the download.
limitations.q5: Can I cancel or delete a shared file before it's downloaded?
limitations.a5: Currently no manual deletion. Files are automatically deleted after your chosen expiration time.

useCases.heading: Use Cases
useCases.good1: Sharing passwords, API keys, or credentials securely
useCases.good2: Sending confidential documents that shouldn't linger
useCases.good3: Quick secure transfers without creating accounts

useCases.badTitle: What is sdbx NOT suitable for?

stillHaveQuestions.heading: Still have questions?
stillHaveQuestions.description: Have a question that's not answered here? Open an issue on GitHub.

whatIs.heading: What is sdbx?
whatIs.p1html: sdbx is a zero-knowledge file sharing service designed with privacy as the core principle. Share files and text securely with end-to-end encryption — via URL link, PIN code, or password-protected vault — with no user tracking.
whatIs.p2html: Unlike traditional file sharing services, sdbx ensures that your files are encrypted before they leave your device, and the encryption key never reaches our servers. This means we literally cannot access your files, even if we wanted to.

mission.heading: Our Mission
mission.p1: In an age where privacy is constantly under threat, we believe that sharing files shouldn't require sacrificing your data or trusting a third party with your sensitive information.
mission.p2: sdbx was built to provide a simple, secure way to share files without:
mission.item1: Creating accounts or providing personal information
mission.item2: Trusting us with your encryption keys
mission.item3: Worrying about files being stored indefinitely

howItWorks.heading: How It Works
howItWorks.encryptionDesc: Your files are encrypted in your browser using AES-256-GCM before upload. We never see the unencrypted content.
howItWorks.zeroKnowledgeDesc: The encryption key and original filename are stored in the URL fragment (#), which is never sent to our servers. Only you and the recipient have access.
howItWorks.noTrackingDesc: No user accounts, no cookies, no analytics, no IP logging. We collect zero personal information.
howItWorks.selfDestructDesc: In URL mode, each file can only be downloaded once, then it's permanently deleted. In PIN mode, you can choose between one-time access or keeping content until expiry. Network failure protection provides a 10-minute retry window.
howItWorks.pinCodeDesc: Share files or text protected by a 4-8 digit PIN. The server generates a unique salt, and a key is derived using PBKDF2 (100,000 iterations). No encryption key in the URL.
howItWorks.vaultModeDesc: Password-protected sharing with unlimited access until expiry. Double encryption layer: content encrypted with a random data key, which is itself encrypted with a password-derived key.

security.heading: Security Features
security.e2eDesc: AES-256-GCM with 256-bit keys generated in your browser
security.botDesc: Google reCAPTCHA v3 prevents automated abuse
security.twoPhaseDesc: Reserve-then-confirm system prevents race conditions and allows retry on network failure
security.originDesc: CloudFront custom headers block direct API access
security.pbkdf2Desc: PIN and Vault modes use 100,000 iterations with SHA-256 for key derivation

techStack.heading: Technology Stack
techStack.intro: sdbx is built with modern, privacy-focused technologies:
techStack.frontendDesc: Vue 3, Web Crypto API, Tailwind CSS, Web Workers for large files

limitations.heading: Limitations
limitations.intro: To ensure optimal performance and security, sdbx has the following limitations:
limitations.expiry: Content expires after max 7 days (custom) or 24 hours (preset)
limitations.accessModes: URL mode: one-time download only. PIN mode: configurable one-time or keep until expiry. Vault: unlimited access until expiry
limitations.maxFiles: Multi-file upload: up to 10 files per bundle

privacy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacy.simplehtml: Simple version: We collect nothing.
privacy.item2: We don't have access to files
privacy.item3: We don't have access to your encryption keys
privacy.item4: We don't log IP addresses for file access (except hashes)
privacy.item5: We don't use cookies, tracking, or analytics
privacy.item6: Files are automatically deleted after first download or expiration
privacy.detail: The only data we store is: encrypted file blobs (which we cannot decrypt), file size, upload timestamp, expiration time, download reservation status, and IP address hash (SHA-256, for abuse prevention only, not linked to files). That's it.

openSource.heading: Open Source
openSource.description: sdbx is open source and available on GitHub. We believe in transparency and invite security researchers to audit our code.

disclaimer.heading: Disclaimer
disclaimer.p1: This service is provided as-is. While we implement strong encryption and security practices, users are responsible for their own data. Do not use sdbx for illegal content.
disclaimer.p2: For sensitive files, we recommend additional security measures like password-protecting archives before upload.

questions.heading: Questions?
questions.description: Have questions, suggestions, or found a security issue?
